Figured out what is the problem with execution of 'pip2.7' under windows: For some reason the dot confuses windows and it will not start the binary. If I try to start 'pip2.7.exe' then it works. Eh.

If you agree I'll extend the groovy script by adding .exe suffix to the pip and python candidates in case of Windows builds.

Refer to this link for build results (access rights to CI server needed): 
https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PreCommit_Java_MavenInstall/8762/
--none--
R: @amitsela

@amitsela Yeah that makes sense, the semantics are `wait` not `stop`, so I guess in these cases where the user wants to wait and stop they can simply call `wait` then call `stop`.
Closing this PR for now.

Thanks, this functionality LGTM.  I'm curious, however, in what environment do you expect this to be used?  I'm not sure it's straightforward to set a custom environmental variable on the GCE Dataflow worker.
R: @dhalperi
LGTM.  Craig tells me that this is for mocking out the metadata service in certain testing environments.
Thanks! Nice.
